I agree with the goal to adapt computers to humans. Today it's the reverse=
. This seems at the heart of the paper, and a good point.=C2=A0


It's not =
as if we haven't tried - lots of GUI based 4GLs and code generators have be=
en developed. But they haven't really succeeded.=C2=A0


Perhaps the iPad i=
s the right metaphor for human users. But it doesn't eliminate or replace c=
oding. Far from it.=C2=A0


Ultimately I'm unsure the paper frames the ques=
tion correctly. I would draw more of a distinction between manufacturing an=
d using computers than suggesting we can do a better job of abstracting cod=
e. That has not and may not work as long as computers themselves are not ch=
anged - meaning as designers and developers we still need to know how the c=
ode will execute and impact HW resources.=C2=A0


Making computers more usa=
ble as a result, however, seems to hold significant promise.


Thanks for p=
osting.


Best,


Eric

ctive Computer Applications=E2=80=9D.=C2=A0

I invite you to follow me on T=
witter at @conways_law or http://twitter.com/conways_law .=C2=A0

lso find the paper at=C2=A0

http://melconway.com/humanize-the-craft.pdf


=
This five-page paper describes, in almost completely nontechnical terms, wh=
at I have learned during a half-century career of thinking mostly about one=
 problem: simplifying the software-building process. It invites the tech co=
mmunity to think differently about applications so that application buildin=
g can be taught in elementary schools. The paper proposes specific design p=
rinciples for the new craft.=C2=A0


You will read in the first paragraph:
=

=E2=80=9COver the span of human history the understanding of three importa=
nt technologies has migrated from the domains of priests to the domains of =
elementary school teachers: arithmetic, writing, and the calendar. Now soft=
ware technology must join this migration.=E2=80=9D


Then:

=E2=80=9CMy sea=
rch for a new approach has led me to thinking about building applications, =
not from what is particular to software, but from what is universal to huma=
nity.=E2=80=9D=C2=A0

ft .=C2=A0


My best,


Mel
